data.title: Brian Wilson - Beach Boy
data.meta_description: With the recent passing of his wife, Brian Wilson, founder of The Beach Boys, is no longer able to care for himself. His music brings to mind our youth for...
data.text:
stephenkatsea

Well-Known Member

Joined

Apr 30, 2008

Messages

8,237

Reaction score

12,039

With the recent passing of his wife, Brian Wilson, founder of The Beach Boys, is no longer able to care for himself. His music brings to mind our youth for many, including myself. Unfortunately, his prior abuse of alcohol and drugs seem to have worsened his bout with dementia. An amazing talent and creator of some outstanding music.

Brian Wilson's Family Seeks Conservatorship for Beach Boys Legend Following Death of His Wife

Brian Wislon — who suffers from a "major neurocognitive disorder (such as dementia)," according to the filing — "will be able to enjoy all of his family and friends and continue to work on current projects," the family said in a statement.

getting old sucks. Watching the ones you love suffer from being elderly, illness, dementia, etc really sucks.

Brian Wilson had some gnarly demons.

Hopefully I’m long gone before quality of life diminishes. Right now I’m applying the carnitas theory. The concept is to eat just the right amount of carnitas over your life time to knock the bad years off the end. One night you go to bed and the next day you wake up dead. However you don’t want to eat to much carnitas and dip into the good years, it’s a fine balance

Sad deal. He’s been dependent for such a long time. If you haven’t seen the movie, Love and Mercy, it’s really good and tells his story from growing up to meeting and marrying Melinda.

Some of my earliest musical memories are from our 8 track of The Beach Boys Endless Summer. Really great songs that are a part of my early childhood.

… wow…I did not know that his wife had passed…

… Brian was born a Gemini… and had dealt with schizophrenia, for much of his life..: the alcohol and drugs were a crutch to a point… And then it all went haywire…

… a brilliant, brilliant composer, and lyricist… RIP… Melinda Wilson…

… ( his bio is definitely worth a read )…

Last edited: Feb 18, 2024

RVR SWPR

Almost Off the Grid

Dec 19, 2007

Messages

13,048

I’ve mentioned a few times i’m coming up on 80 years. The last few years have been interesting. My family and especially my wife have been great. We have been at the Landing 15 years now.

The first episode or sign of change came up few years ago. Explained to wife i need do a quick turn around to Ventura regarding our business. Fact is i responded to Scream & Fly advertisement for boat for sale in Louisiana,made a deal on phone with a great guy. We agreed meet in Duncanville Texas. 3 days later came home with awesome STV. Family was amused. Next up a year after that trip explained to wife a trip to Phoenix for us to just get away. Again,fact is on phone pretty much had agreed if boat was as advertised would purchase. We came home with a boat i always admired 1979 Campbell. Well,for many years i did my best for family and business especially my awesome wife of almost 50 years. These days they let me think i’m still in control but the leash has gotten shorter these days but stll having some good times . Incredible neighbors at the landing that show up every weekend.

But it goes much deeper than that....Wilson was a genius. I've never read, or seen anything to the contrary. Pet Sounds is a mandatory piece of any respectable vinyl collection.

Wishing him the best.

… damn… I just listened to pet sounds all the way through… What an absolute masterpiece… I was able to decipher some of the things that Brian used in leau of musical instruments… It would take a few more spins to pick out some more… As I started to get a bit spacey..,

…. while listening and somewhat spacing -…It reminded me of probably 2016… I had stopped by an old friends family home… We will just call her Piano Peggy… Probably Google-able…She was not there but her brother was…a judge… Oddly enough two judges, grew up on the same nondescript block …

… anyway, her brother Mel told me that Piano Peggy’s boyfriend had done the first movie for television,of the beach boys… I can’t remember her boyfriends name and I can’t remember the name of the movie… it may have been done in the 80s???..,

First saw The Beach Boys in 63-64 in our Downey HS gym. They were great. Later saw them in Vegas, late 70s and they were terrible. Brian had just returned to the band.

Dennis Wilson - Drums, died of drowning in 1983 in MDR. He was 39, married 5 times and had connections to Charles Manson and family. Significant drug and alcohol abuse.

Carl Wilson - Lead guitar, died of lung cancer 1998 in Los Angeles. He was 51, married to Dean Martin’s daughter, Gina.

Brian Wilson's Family Seeks Conservatorship for Beach Boys Legend Following Death of His Wife

Brian Wislon — who suffers from a "major neurocognitive disorder (such as dementia)," according to the filing — "will be able to enjoy all of his family and friends and continue to work on current projects," the family said in a statement.

Just curious how do you know the dementia is because of prior use of alcohol etc?

Didn’t say the dementia was because of prior use of alcohol. Reportedly, his prior abuse has worsened his present bout with dementia. I’m sure there are some who never drank, but also suffer from dementia. There’s a lot yet to be learned about dementia. It’s a bad deal, for sure.

Unlike his brothers, I don’t believe Carl abused drugs and alcohol. Carl was a longtime cigarette smoker. He died of Lung Cancer.
